g.text: GND densities are thus computed from both HR-EBSD and Laue measurements and compared with the CPFE

GND densities over all slip systems

shows the total GND density computed from HR-EBSD, Laue diffraction and CPFE datasets, plotted
on the YZ, XZ and the XY cross sections at the indent centre. To enable a direct comparison with both Laue and
HR-EBSD measurements, the CPFE predictions are plotted on two different length scales. Complementing each
other, the high angular resolution of Laue measurements
and high spatial resolution of HR-EBSD measure-
detect the far-field and near-field deformation respectively. In the unimplanted sample, a small zone
of high GND density is seen close to the indent (Fig.
), with a surrounding larger zone of low GND density
). In contrast, the implanted sample shows a relatively larger zone of high GND density surrounding the
), with a surprisingly sharp boundary and very low GND density outside this region (Fig.
The experimental observations show a similar picture, consistent with the predictions from CPFE.
The CPFE formulation for the helium-implanted sample was based on the hypothesis of removal of
helium-implantation-induced obstacles by the progressive passage of dislocations. This leads to defect-free slip
channels that accommodate deformation in the implanted zone, near the indent, and give rise to a large pile up.
As a result, a more compact plastic zone is expected in the implanted material, which is clearly seen in the spatial
Total GND density plotted on YZ, XZ and the XY cross-sections through the indent centre. GND
density was calculated using L2 optimisation. Predictions from CPFE calculations are shown in (
) for the helium-implanted sample. GND density computed from Laue
diffraction measurements for the unimplanted and implanted samples are shown in (
GND density determined by HR-EBSD for the unimplanted and the implanted sample is shown in (
respectively. The same colour scale is used for all plots showing log
are plotted on the same length scale. (
) show magnified plots of GND density and are also all
shown on the same length scale.
